doc.previous: Stowers was recommended for the Medal of Honor shortly after his death but according to the Army the nomination was misplaced Many believed the recommendation had been intentionally ignored due to institutional racism in the Armed Forces In 1990 under pressure from Congress the Defense Department launched an investigation Based on findings from this investigation the Army Decorations Board approved the award of the Medal of Honor to Stowers On April 24 1991 73 years after he was killed in action Stowers two surviving sisters received the Medal of Honor from President George H W Bush at the White House
